definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: Have we all so soon forgotten the tragedy of the Third Fleet of Kul Tiras?
sentences.chinese: 難道我們這麼快便忘記了庫爾提拉斯第三艦隊的慘劇？

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the boy’s family is still not aware of the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 這時，男孩的家人還不知道這一場慘劇。

sentences.english: Munich is the greatest tragedy in Uniteds history.
sentences.chinese: 幕尼黑空難是曼聯汗青上最大的慘劇。

sentences.english: But what is it about schools which mean that this kind of tragedy occurs?
sentences.chinese: 但是是什麼原因使學校成爲慘劇的溫牀呢？

sentences.english: I think they are responsible for large-scale human miseries in Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲他們對巴基斯坦的大規模人類慘劇負有責任。

sentences.english: The current competition for jobs has created something of a dog-eat-dog arena.
sentences.chinese: 目前對工作的競爭已經創造了狗喫狗的競爭慘劇。

sentences.english: But I fear the trajectory of political hotheadedness in the U.S. will come to tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 但我擔心在美國政治衝動將釀成慘劇。

sentences.english: The case is sensational and horribly tragic.
sentences.chinese: 這一案例十分轟動，也是十足的慘劇。

sentences.english: During the fire in Shanghai Business School, four female students jumped into death, when could campus tragedy stop?
sentences.chinese: 上海商學院火災“四女墜亡”，校園慘劇何時休？

sentences.english: Mr Brown says SeaWorld has never experienced an incident like this。
sentences.chinese: 他還稱，海洋世界從未發生過這樣的慘劇。

definition: to die in an accident or disaster/to be killed
to set on fire/to commit arson
terrorist attack (abbr. for 恐怖襲擊|恐怖袭击[kong3 bu4 xi2 ji1])
to crash (into another car)/(fig.) (of opinions, schedules etc) to clash/(of subject matter) to be the same
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
out of order (of machine)/not working properly/a failing (of a system)
to inflict heavy losses/to inflict serious damage
